intro: Gutierrezia spathulata var. gilliesii, commonly known as Gillies' goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy yellow composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually linear and gray-green, and it produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. This species is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
